questions.question: What is the derivative of 3x⁴ - 2x³?
questions.prompt_template: Find the derivative of {question} step-by-step. Show all work and explain each step using the power rule.

questions.question: Find the derivative of sin(x) + cos(x)
questions.prompt_template: Calculate the derivative of {question}. Explain the derivatives of trigonometric functions and show your work.

questions.question: What is the derivative of e^(2x)?
questions.prompt_template: Find the derivative of {question}. Use the chain rule and explain each step clearly.

questions.question: Find the derivative of ln(x²)
questions.prompt_template: Calculate the derivative of {question} step-by-step. Apply the chain rule and logarithm properties.

questions.question: What is the derivative of x³ + 5x² - 7x + 2?
questions.prompt_template: Find the derivative of {question}. Apply the power rule to each term and show your work.

questions.question: Find the derivative of tan(x)
questions.prompt_template: Calculate the derivative of {question}. Use the quotient rule with sin(x)/cos(x) and simplify.

questions.question: What is the derivative of √x (square root of x)?
questions.prompt_template: Find the derivative of {question}. Rewrite as x^(1/2) and apply the power rule.

questions.question: Find the derivative of 5e^x - 3x²
questions.prompt_template: Calculate the derivative of {question}. Remember that the derivative of e^x is e^x.

questions.question: What is the derivative of x⁵ - 4x³ + x?
questions.prompt_template: Find the derivative of {question} using the power rule for each term.

questions.question: Find the derivative of cos(2x)
questions.prompt_template: Calculate the derivative of {question}. Apply the chain rule and show each step.

questions.question: What is the derivative of 1/x?
questions.prompt_template: Find the derivative of {question}. Rewrite as x^(-1) and apply the power rule.

questions.question: Find the derivative of x²·e^x using the product rule
questions.prompt_template: Calculate the derivative of {question}. Apply the product rule: d/dx[f·g] = f'g + fg'.

questions.question: Simplify: (3/4) + (2/3)
questions.prompt_template: Solve {question}. Show all steps including finding the common denominator and simplifying.

questions.question: What is (5/6) × (4/15)?
questions.prompt_template: Calculate {question} step-by-step. Show the multiplication and simplification process.

questions.question: Divide: (3/8) ÷ (9/16)
questions.prompt_template: Solve {question}. Explain the process of dividing fractions using the reciprocal method.

questions.question: Simplify: (2/5) - (1/3)
questions.prompt_template: Calculate {question}. Show how to find the common denominator and subtract the fractions.

questions.question: Add: (5/8) + (3/4)
questions.prompt_template: Solve {question}. Find the LCD and add the fractions step-by-step.

questions.question: Multiply: (7/9) × (3/14)
questions.prompt_template: Calculate {question}. Multiply numerators and denominators, then simplify by canceling common factors.

questions.question: Simplify: (4/5) ÷ (2/3)
questions.prompt_template: Solve {question}. Multiply by the reciprocal and simplify.

questions.question: Subtract: (7/12) - (1/4)
questions.prompt_template: Calculate {question}. Convert to a common denominator and subtract.

questions.question: Add: (1/6) + (2/9) + (1/3)
questions.prompt_template: Solve {question}. Find the LCD for all three fractions and add them together.

questions.question: Simplify: (15/20) to lowest terms
questions.prompt_template: Reduce {question}. Find the GCF of numerator and denominator and divide both by it.

questions.question: What is (2/3)² (two-thirds squared)?
questions.prompt_template: Calculate {question}. Square both the numerator and denominator.

questions.question: Divide: (5/6) ÷ (10/9)
questions.prompt_template: Solve {question}. Multiply by the reciprocal and simplify completely.

questions.question: What is sin(30°)?
questions.prompt_template: Find {question}. Explain using the unit circle or special right triangles.

questions.question: Calculate cos(60°)
questions.prompt_template: Determine {question}. Use the unit circle and explain the relationship to the 30-60-90 triangle.

questions.question: What is tan(45°)?
questions.prompt_template: Find {question}. Explain using the definition of tangent and the 45-45-90 triangle.

questions.question: Simplify: sin²(x) + cos²(x)
questions.prompt_template: Simplify {question}. Explain the Pythagorean identity and its proof.

questions.question: What is sin(90°)?
questions.prompt_template: Find {question}. Use the unit circle to explain why this equals 1.

questions.question: Calculate cos(0°)
questions.prompt_template: Determine {question}. Explain using the unit circle starting position.

questions.question: What is tan(60°)?
questions.prompt_template: Find {question}. Use sin(60°)/cos(60°) and simplify.

questions.question: What is sin(45°)?
questions.prompt_template: Calculate {question}. Use the 45-45-90 triangle to derive this value.

questions.question: Find cos(45°)
questions.prompt_template: Determine {question}. Explain why sin(45°) = cos(45°) using the unit circle.

questions.question: What is tan(30°)?
questions.prompt_template: Calculate {question}. Use sin(30°)/cos(30°) and rationalize if needed.

questions.question: What is cos(90°)?
questions.prompt_template: Find {question}. Use the unit circle to explain why the x-coordinate is 0 at 90°.

questions.question: Simplify: 1 + tan²(x)
questions.prompt_template: Simplify {question}. Use the Pythagorean identity and explain the relationship.
